page.title: 01Parham & Wiggonholt
page.content: Lying below the northern escarpment of Rackham Hill, most of the area belongs to Parham Estate. Parham House, a fine Elizabethan manor, is the main southern feature standing in a deer park. Most of the central area is woodland and common, where the chalk and clay soils give way to a greensand belt running east to west. The river Arun crosses the north-western corner, joined by dykes and drainage ditches through the water-meadows there. the eastern ede of this area has the river Stor and the A283 road from the hamlet of Cootham to Pulborough through it. the West Sussex Golf Course and the Southdown Gliding club are the main attractions here, together with the Crown - a very old inn. there are in the whole area, two tiny churhes and four farms. there is no major industrial employer. People work
